DataSource.Name: Default
DataSource.SQL: select A.AccountId as [Account ID], A.AccountStatus as [Account Status], A.AccountCode as [Account Code], A.EntityType as [Entity Type Code], UsrLogin.UserName as [Account Username], UsrEmail.UserName as [Account Username (email)], A.DisplayName [Account Name], Stuff(( select ', ' + CAT.CategoryCode from tbCategory2Entity C2E inner join tbCategory CAT on CAT.CategoryId=C2E.CategoryId where C2E.EntityId=A.AccountId order by CAT.CategoryName FOR XML PATH('') ), 1, 2, '') as [Category Codes], Stuff(( select ', ' + CAT.CategoryName from tbCategory2Entity C2E inner join tbCategory CAT on CAT.CategoryId=C2E.CategoryId where C2E.EntityId=A.AccountId order by CAT.CategoryName FOR XML PATH('') ), 1, 2, '') as [Category Names], AD.FirstName as [First Name], AD.LastName as [Last Name], AD.CompanyName as [Company], AD.Address as [Address], AD.ZipCode as [Zip Code], AD.City as [City], AD.Province as [Province], AD.State as [State], AD.Country as [Country], AD.HomePhone as [Home Phone], AD.BusinessPhone as [Business Phone], AD.MobilePhone as [Mobile], AD.Fax as [Fax], AD.EmailAddress as [Email Address], AD.ExternalCode as [External Code], AD.NickName as [Nickname], (select top 1 LogDateTime from tbHistoryLog where EntityId=A.AccountId and HistoryLogType in (1,2)/*Create/LastUpdate*/ order by LogDateTime desc) as [Last Update] from tbAccount A left join tbAccountDetail AD on AD.AccountId=A.AccountId left join tbLoginAlias UsrLogin on UsrLogin.AccountId=A.AccountId and UsrLogin.PrimaryAlias=1 left join tbLoginAlias UsrEmail on UsrEmail.AccountId=A.AccountId and UsrEmail.LoginAliasType=1 where (:@EntityType is null or A.EntityType=:@EntityType) and (:@LastUpdate is null or A.AccountId in (select EntityId from tbHistoryLog where HistoryLogType in (1,2) and LogDateTime>=:@LastUpdate)) and ( Coalesce(:@CategoryCode, '')='' or A.AccountId in ( select EntityId from tbCategory CAT inner join tbCategory2Entity C2E on C2E.CategoryId=CAT.CategoryId where CAT.CategoryCode=:@CategoryCode ) ) order by A.DisplayName

RichDescItem.Description:
Accounts Report

Abstract

“Accounts” generates a report of the details of all created accounts (active, blocked, deleted) since the last update.​​​​​​​

Generating the report

Parameter Input
While generating the report, input parameters menu presents an intuitive interface.
Built-in wizards will help you quickly and easily create at your choice profile for your site by
  • [Account Category Code] – Account Category (see ACCOUNTS >> People). When null, default is all the categories
  • [Account Type] – Account Type. Default is “15” = PERSON. When null, default is all the entities (see LOOKUP TABLES >> EntityType)
  • [Last Update] – Last update Date and Time, easy to select.
Output File Extension
Built-in wizards will help you easily and quickly generate at your choice reports in XLSX or CSV or PDF formats. Format selection is required before running the report.​​​​​​​
  • XLSX
    • Report generates an EXCEL (latest version) file
  • CSV
    • its generation requires:
      • Field delimiter: Separator to be put between fields. Usually a "comma". When null, default is taken from user configuration.
      • Quote character: Character used to surround fields
      • Include header line to tick the box. Default is YES.
  • PDF
    • Report generates a PDF (latest version) file

Header

Report parameters
  • [Execution date/time] - Report Execution Time. Date and Hours format as per configuration [Location, Operating Area, Workstation]
  • [Account Category Code] – Account Category
  • [Account Type] – Account Type.
  • [Last Update] – Last update Date and Time. Display format as per configuration [Location, Operating Area, Workstation]

Contents (by Columns)

The program produces easy-to-read reports that include text information.
  • [Account ID] – Account ID
  • [Account Status] – Account Status # (1: Active; 2: Blocked; 3: Deleted)
  • [Account Code] – Account Code
  • [Entity Type Code] - Entity Type Code # (see LOOKUP TABLES >> EntityType, Table Code: 131)
  • [Account Username] – Account Login Username
  • [Login Email] - Account Login Mail address
  • [Account Username (email)] – Account User Name. Display format “Last Name, First Name”
  • [Account Name (description)] – Account User Name. Display format “Last Name, First Name”
  • [Category Code] – Account Category Code
  • [Category Name] - Category Naming
  • [First Name] - Account First Name
  • [Last Name] - Account Last Name
  • [Company] - Company Name
  • [Address] - Address
  • [Zip Code] - Zip Code
  • [City] - City
  • [Province] - Province
  • [State] - State
  • [Country] - Country
  • [Home Phone] – Home Phone. Format Display: “(area code) phone_number”
  • [Business Phone] – Business/Office Phone. Format Display: “(area code) phone_number”
  • [Mobile] – Mobile Phone. Format Display: “(area code) phone_number”
  • [Fax] – Fax. Format Display: “(area code) phone_number”
  • [Email Address] – User Mail address
  • [External Code] - External code
  • [Nickname] – Account Nickname
  • [Last Update] – Last update Date (Date and Hours format as per configuration [Location, Operating Area, Workstation])
